Description: Intact pottery guttus, black glazed. Fine clay fabric.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Excavated from a well by Hogarth in 1903, 'not' from the 'Pre Persian town'. but in a deposit dated to the 5th century BC and said to be given to the Egyptian Museum in Cairo, although this object was not registered there (Edgar 1905, 123-5, Fig.4).
Compare Sparkes and Talcott, Agora 12, 319 no. 1196, pl. 39 (dated 320BC).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GS.380) (Phase 3)
